question: You recently went shopping at the local supermarket. When you got home and noticed your bill, you found that you had been charged for items you did not purchase. Write a letter to the supermarket manager explaining what has happened. Tell the manager you are not able to collect the refund and suggest a refund method and say what do you want him to do
text: I am writing to express my disappointment with the incident of being overcharged at your shopping mall. Though I have been to this place for buying grocery for a very long time, this has happened to me for the first time.

Yesterday evening, I went to the supermarket to buy some kitchen and other domestic stuff. I paid bills at counter number 4 using my credit card. The shop was crowded as usual and I was also in a hurry as I had to return home to receive someone. Today, when I unpacked all the items and matched them with the receipt given by the counter girl. I found to be cheated with 142 dollars for a magic mop and a pack of vermicelli that I did not purchase.

As I have to leave the town for some urgent official work and will be returned after a week, I request you to refund the amount in the credit card it was debited from. It would be easier for both me and you as well.
Kindly go through the matter and do the needful. I do hope you would not lose a regular and loyal customer. I will be waiting to get a response that all is in order.

error_list.error_des: It seems that grocery may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
